main event: A bright metallic oval-shaped object was observed both visually and on ground radar in Vincennes, Indiana on March 26, 1961.
interesting points: The object gave off flashes of light and appeared to depart the scene at a high rate of speed.
The object was observed for 10 minutes.
A previous letter mentioned a strange object in the sky over the Indiana area on July 21, 1951.
The object's appearance and course could not be attributed to any known aerial device.
The sighting was confirmed by both visual and radar observations.
